intro: Uragoga subtomentosa, commonly known as the hairy uragoga, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. It produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Uragoga subtomentosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
